item.title: NPC drops
item.dc:creator: @kieran_X kieran X
item.description:
@kieran_X wrote:

Lets say your npc is ‘’ 17 ‘’ which is a barbarian.

Go into npchandler and find this

[shadow=red,left]if (npcs[NPCID].npcType == 17) { ItemHandler.addItem(Item3.randombarbarian(), npcs[NPCID].absX, npcs[NPCID].absY, 1, GetNpcKiller(NPCID), false); }[/shadow]

add that to a row in your npc handler under ones similar, watch the brackets are correctly placed.

now go into item3, where we will make randombarbarian

public static int barbarian[] = { 15333, 15334, 15335, 15336, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995, 995}; 
public static int randombarbarian() {
    return barbarian[(int) (Math.random() * barbarian.length)];
}</blockquote>

all the ‘’ 995 ‘’ is coins that will act as drops.
he 15333-15336 is the godsword drops.
The more 995 there are the more chance you have of dropping coins.

save and compile

Read full topic
